html:
PC Number Date Chapter Bill Dept
 2023-11252023-11-09PCH
ActBroadcasting Act
SubjectOrder Issuing Directions to the CRTC (Sustainable and Equitable Broadcasting Regulatory Framework)
PrecisORDER ISSUING DIRECTIONS TO THE CRTC (SUSTAINABLE AND EQUITABLE REGULATORY FRAMEWORK FOR BROADCASTING) in order to (1) ensure the meaningful participation of Indigenous persons in the broadcasting system; (2) exclude social media users and creators and their content from regulation; (3) support greater inclusion of equity-seeking groups and ethnocultural groups in the broadcasting system; (4) support the vitality of official language minority communities (OLMCs) in Canada and fostering the full recognition and use of both English and French in Canadian society;(5)Support Canadian creators and media, including independent and community-run elements; (6) implementing discoverability requirements in a way that minimizes the need to alter the algorithms of broadcasting undertakings and that, where possible, increases choice for users; (7) redefine Canadian programs; and (8) create an equitable, flexible and adaptable regulatory framework.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2023-0239 Publication Date: 2023-11-22
AttachmentsAttachment
subject: Order Issuing Directions to the CRTC (Sustainable and Equitable Broadcasting Regulatory Framework)
precis: ORDER ISSUING DIRECTIONS TO THE CRTC (SUSTAINABLE AND EQUITABLE REGULATORY FRAMEWORK FOR BROADCASTING) in order to (1) ensure the meaningful participation of Indigenous persons in the broadcasting system; (2) exclude social media users and creators and their content from regulation; (3) support greater inclusion of equity-seeking groups and ethnocultural groups in the broadcasting system; (4) support the vitality of official language minority communities (OLMCs) in Canada and fostering the full recognition and use of both English and French in Canadian society;(5)Support Canadian creators and media, including independent and community-run elements; (6) implementing discoverability requirements in a way that minimizes the need to alter the algorithms of broadcasting undertakings and that, where possible, increases choice for users; (7) redefine Canadian programs; and (8) create an equitable, flexible and adaptable regulatory framework.
